page.title: 05FARMING IN BUCHANAN
page.content: There are 3{farms}around Buchanan. {Gartincaber Farm}is owned by Lord Graham. The house is lived in by William McNiven. William farms Gartincaber. The farm has about 200 cows. It is mostly grassland but there is some arable land too. Robert Allan helps with the cows. Men are employed for the silage,hay and barley. The farm is about 250 years old. {Creity Hall Farm}is 205 years old. It is owned by the{Duke of Montrose. Sheds have been knocked down and new wooden sheds have been put up. Electric fences have been erected to keep sheep in. It is farmed by Walter McAllister and Robert Allan. There are about 200 sheep and roughly 100 cows. The land is grassland and fields of arable. It is grazed by cows and sheep.
